intro: Wikstroemia haoi, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and often have a bluish-green hue. Wikstroemia haoi is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
